content:
=== Game Rules ===
Game rules in natural language:
Here’s a plain‐language breakdown of the game’s design and a high‐level strategy for playing it:

1. Game Genre and Overall Aim
 • It’s a puzzle–platformer with action elements. You control an avatar (a spelunky type character) in a level full of obstacles, enemies, and precious resources.
 • The goal is to navigate the level, overcome or avoid hazards (like falling boulders and moving foes), and collect enough diamonds. Once you’ve gathered enough diamonds, you must reach the exit door—a key interaction that removes the door and signals that you’ve “won.”

2. Key Game Mechanics
 • World and Obstacles: The level is built with various immovable elements like walls, dirt, and background tiles. Some objects (e.g., boulders) move slowly and act like missiles (falling downward), adding environmental hazards.
 • Resources and Score: Diamonds are scattered throughout the level as a resource that, when picked up by the avatar, increase your score (each gives +2 points). Additionally, some enemy interactions (for example, a butterfly bumping a crab) can also yield resources (transforming an enemy into a diamond with a bonus).
 • Combat and Interactions: Your avatar carries a sword (or pickaxe-like tool) which can be used to “kill” certain sprites upon contact with environmental objects like dirt. There are detailed interactions: for instance, if you land on a boulder from above, it gets “killed” but you lose score, and some enemy encounters can incur penalties.
 • Exit Conditions: When interacting with the exit door, a special check occurs—the door will only let you pass if you’ve collected enough diamonds (specifically, if you have more than 9, based on the “killIfOtherHasMore” rule). Reaching the door with the proper resource tally removes the door (termination condition with win=True), letting you complete the level.

3. Win/Loss Conditions
 • Loss: If at any point your avatar is eliminated (the avatar sprite count hits 0), you lose.
 • Win: Successfully exiting the level by clearing the exit door (i.e. the exit door sprite is removed) signals victory. To do that, you must have at least 10 diamonds or more, as per the door’s condition.

4. Overall Strategy Advice
 • Explore methodically: Move carefully through the level, keeping an eye out for diamonds and making sure you meet that crucial resource quota.
 • Manage hazards smartly: Learn the behavior of boulders and moving obstacles. Use them to possibly eliminate enemies (for example, positioning yourself to use falling boulders to your advantage) while avoiding accidental self-harm.
 • Engage enemies wisely: Decide whether to neutralize foes directly using your sword or use environmental interactions (like letting a butterfly bump a crab to transform it into a diamond) to boost your resources.
 • Balance risk and reward: While eliminating boulders or enemies might sometimes cost score points (remember, some actions impose a penalty), don’t shy away from necessary risks if collecting resources and reaching safe passages is your priority.
 • Check your inventory: Monitor your diamond count. Don’t head for the exit until you’re sure you’ve hit (or surpassed) the required number; premature exit interactions might result in avatar death.

In sum, the game blends classic action-puzzle elements with resource management—navigate the maze-like level, defeat or outsmart the enemy sprites, collect enough gems, and then use the exit door to win. Patience, careful observation of enemy and obstacle patterns, and smart resource management are your keys to success.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT
4: ACTION_DOWN
5: ACTION_UP

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game. 

=== Sprite Mapping ===
avatar -> 'a'
background dirt -> '.'
background -> '-'
background exitdoor -> 'e'
background boulder -> 'o'
background diamond -> 'x'
background crab -> 'c'
background butterfly -> 'b'
boulder -> '@'
butterfly -> '#'
crab -> '$'
diamond -> '%'
dirt -> '&'
exitdoor -> '*'
wall -> 'b'

I'm moving left from our current position (row4, col12) with the aim of heading toward a nearby diamond cluster, which fits our strategy to collect enough resources before heading for the exit.
